pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we ported a part of Andrew Yang's lean3 repository at [this repository](https://github.com/erdOne/lean-AG-morphisms), which is appoved by @erdOne after his discussion with @chrisflav.

Andrew defined `min_generator_card` and `spanrank` in this repository (it's at /dimension_theory/min_generator_card), we ported this, and ported some basic lemmas about it.

Co-authored-by:
@erdOne
@xyzw12345 [wangjt2020@163.com](mailto:wangjt2020@163.com)
@jjdishere [emailboxofjjd@163.com](mailto:emailboxofjjd@163.com)
@Blackfeather007 [2100017455@stu.pku.edu.cn](mailto:2100017455@stu.pku.edu.cn)

--- 
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [66e16b69ec](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20744/commits/66e16b69ec4d1eca085de7498ef13f038af63b0d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.MinGeneratorCard` (new file)|901|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FG.exists_fun_minGeneratorCard_span_range_eq`
`+ FG.minGenerator`
`+ FG.minGeneratorMem`
`+ FG.spanMinGeneratorRange`
`+ FG.spanRank_le_iff_exists_span_range_eq`
`+ fg_iff_card_finset_nonempty`
`+ fg_iff_spanrank_eq`
`+ minGeneratorCard`
`+ spanRank`
`+ spanRank_ne_top_iff_fg`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks a lot for all the porting work! I left some comments.
Thanks a lot for all the porting work! I left some comments.

```suggestion
* `minGeneratorCard`: The minimum cardinality of a generating set of a submodule as a natural number.
  If no finite generating set exists, the minimum cardinality is defined to be `0`.
```

Could you please use the nice `ENat` notation here? And explain the difference between `spanRank` and `minGeneratorCard`.

Also I am not sure about the naming. I think the two should be named similarly, maybe `Submodule.spanRank` and `Submodule.spanRankNat`?

```suggestion
* `FG.exists_fun_minGeneratorCard_span_range_eq` : Any finitely generated submodule has a generating
  family of cardinality equal to `minGeneratorCard`.
```
And please also adapt the wording here.
I don't think this lemma is needed.

```suggestion
/-- An arbitrarily chosen generating family of minimal cardinality. -/
noncomputable def FG.minGenerator {p : Submodule R M} (h : p.FG) : Fin p.minGeneratorCard  M :=
  Classical.choose (exists_fun_minGeneratorCard_span_range_eq h)
```

```suggestion
lemma FG.span_range_minGenerator {p : Submodule R M} (h : p.FG) :
```

```suggestion
lemma FG.minGenerator_mem {p : Submodule R M} (h : p.FG) (i) :
```
Does the `simp` have to be squeezed here? In general, if it is a terminal `simp`, please avoid `simp only` if possible.
Do you need the `f'`? It seems, it is only used once and then unfolded immediatly in multiple places.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Module): the minimum cardinality of generating set

source.title: Tracking issue: dimension theory of (commutative) rings

nodes.body: Thanks a lot for all the porting work! I left some comments.
